revised_title: Investigating Molecular Weights and Intrinsic Viscosities of Polymers
tldr: The authors developed a method to investigate the relationship between molecular weights and intrinsic viscosities of polymers, specifically focusing on polystyrene. They found that the Houwink equation with an exponent of approximately 3.4 accurately describes the relationship. This method can be used to calculate the number-average degree of polymerization and molecular weight distribution in unfractionated polymers.
